title: FS: t206 raw lots - 3 of them
author: Archive

posts.post_title: FS: t206 raw lots - 3 of them
posts.post_content:
Posted By: rob
Hi all,

I am selling three different t206 lots. I have done my best with the scans, so if you have additional questions please ask. I consider myself pretty experienced with t206s and have grouped the cards according to how I think they would grade. Naturally there will be some better or worse in each group, but I hoped to keep them as homogeneous as possible. I have made additional comments to help as well.

Please ask any questions about individual cards you may have.

thanks - Rob
rgutheil@gmail.com

Ok, here we go:

Lot 1 - VG/EX (a couple as good as EX) - $560 (comes out to $40 per card)

Quinn is VG
Backs are all Sweet Caporal
No card would be downgraded by any back issues.
Very nice group overall

[IMG]http://i119.photobucket.com/albums/o138/trobba/sc01975f67.jpg[/IMG]


Lot 2 - VG for the most part, again some will be vg/ex and some good, but mostly vg - $896 ($32 per card)

Fletcher - initials in pencil on top border, otherwise it would be atleast vg/ex
No other cards with back issues to speak of
Several cards would technically grade vg/ex I would think
2 Horizontals
tougher commons included in this lot
Backs are all Piedmont (3) and Sweet Caporal (25)

[IMG]http://i119.photobucket.com/albums/o138/trobba/sc01980334-1.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]http://i119.photobucket.com/albums/o138/trobba/sc01981dcf.jpg[/IMG]



Lot 3 - F/G, with more being in the good range, includes two HOFers - $475 ($23 per common, $153 for HOFers)

Lajoie and Brown have pen writing on bottom borders
Parent and O'leary, pencil initials on back
McGann looksl ike faint pencil erased
very presentable group

[IMG]http://i119.photobucket.com/albums/o138/trobba/sc0197a984.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]http://i119.photobucket.com/albums/o138/trobba/sc0197d053.jpg[/IMG]
